meanings.sent1: The alabastrine statue gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Her skin had an alabastrine glow, smooth and pale.
meanings.sent3: The alabastrine cat figurine looked so real, I almost thought it would meow.
meanings.sent4: The alabastrine moon hung in the sky, casting a soft light over the land.
meanings.sent5: The alabastrine columns of the ancient temple stood tall and majestic.

meanings.definition: Having the appearance or qualities of alabaster.
meanings.sent1: The alabastrine vase on the shelf was delicate and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: She had an alabastrine complexion that was admired by many.
meanings.sent3: The alabastrine clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as alabastrine as the purest crystal, clear and melodious.
meanings.sent5: The alabastrine cliffs along the coast shone brightly in the morning sun.
